Na isnavaan in, munkumbu masnanava, tupa taimi’isnanavan tu, “mindangkaza! mastauqtauq!”
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

Pidaingun zami qalinga tupa tu, “sinsi miqumisang!”
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」

Isnavan aam a, sinsi masnava isisipul i itumalasBunn tu qalinga
In class, the teacher taught us the Bunun language of numbers.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。

Sisisli aam sinsi masipul, tusasaus aam isisipul tu sintusasaus.
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。

Mapasnava aak madia tu itumalasBunun tu qalinga.
I have learned many Bunun languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我學會好多族語。

Qanglas aak munKaku, qanglas aak mapasnava malasBunun qalinga, na bazbaz aak patan’a ki Tina.
I go to school every day, I learn the Bunun language every day, and I want to tell my mother.
我今天七點到學校。: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。

Maa naak ngan a Tulbus
My name is Tulbus.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的名字是Tulbus。

Maa naak Tama ngan a tupaun tu Sipal.
My dad’s name is Sipal.
我今天七點到學校。: 我爸爸的名字是Sipal。

Maa naak Tina ngan a tupan tu Mai’ia.
My mother’s name is Mai’ia.
我今天七點到學校。: 我媽媽的名字是Mai’ia。

Mas’an naak haip punsanan qamisan.
I am 10 years old.
我今天七點到學校。: 我今年10歲。

Haiza naak tas’a masituqas-nanaz tupaun ngan tu Vilian, mas’an qan tas’a istaa qamisan
I have a brother, his name is Vilian, he is 11 years old.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Vilian，他今年11歲。

Muskun aam ihaan tas’a kaku vingkiu.
We study in the same school.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們在同一間學校讀書。

Ma aak siin masituqas-nanaz naak a mazima aam tusasaus.
Both my brother and I like to sing.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。

Mazima aak tun’apap, maqi pal’un a, amin aam tastulumaq muskun tun’apap.
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。

Mazima aak mapasaqal baqlu kaviaz, maqtu aam muskun tusasaus siin tun’apap.
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。

Bunun siduq aak tu uvaz’az.
I am an Bunun child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我是布農族的小孩。

Inaam lumaq ihaan Bahu’an.
Our family lives in Bahu’an.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家住在馬遠。

Inaak tastulumaq haiza hahima bunun.
There are five people in our family.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家共有五個人。

Inaam tastulumaq haiza tatau tais’aan.
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。

Muskun aak Tama, Tina, masituqas-nanaz siin masituqas-nau’az katuskun aam.
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.
我今天七點到學校。: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。

Inaak Tama malaungkav, Sasbinaz naak Tama ka.
My father is tall and he is a policeman.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。

Innak Tina makuis, Ising naak Tina ka.
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。

Maaq Tama ihaan lumaq a malasBnun pabazbaz zami.
My father speaks the Bunun language with us at home.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。

Maqei pal’un aam a musuqais aam mun asang.
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們暑假都會回部落。

Muskun aak inaak masituqas-nanaz masituqas-nau’az madamu auk’auk.
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。

Mazima aak inaak tastulumaq tu Bunun.
I like our family very much.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很喜歡我們家的人。

Haip qanian dusa aak Tina munata qaitmal.
I went out with my mother today.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。

Qanian tu diqanin masanglav saa, nii tu makazhav nii amin mabaqais, makahav a luvluv.
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.
我今天七點到學校。: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。

Ihaan aam nastu ismuut mamaun i anpang, sanvaliun valih a hubung, manangqat saa.
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。

Tinaungqu’, tindangqas in na diqanin.
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.
我今天七點到學校。: 下午，天空變紅了。

Tupauk Tina tu, mavia ka diqanin madangqas.
I asked my mother why the sky is red.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的。

Tupa Tina tu, na lauq naluvluvan.
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.
我今天七點到學校。: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。

Sanavan diqanin uka luhum, santasal in bintuqan.
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.
我今天七點到學校。: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。

Na mudanin amin aam mulumaq.
We were going home too.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們也要回家了。

Ihaan na mulumaq tu daan, taquan zaku a bintuqan inaak tu aikas’angan.
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,
我今天七點到學校。: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，

Duu maqtu luvluvan nii tu minsuma, asang aak munata qaitmal.
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.
我今天七點到學校。: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。

Ma naak Kaku a ihaan inaak lumaq di’ngalan, qanglas aak tan’anak munKaku, tan’anak amin musuqais lumaq.
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。

Nii naam Kaku madaing, nii amin papia pantu, pasasaqal amin.
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。

Kaupa ka pantu mu’anpuk haan daisiqdaing, muskun aam qaitmal mali, muskun pababazbaz.

Maqa Sinsi a muskun amin zami qaitmal, maqa Kaku a maszang tastulumaq.

Maisiqailis aam ma’asik, mintus aam piningzav inaam pasnanavan tu da’ngianan.
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。

Haiza a maqaiqais vanas, haiza a ma’asik.
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.
我今天七點到學校。: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。

Ma’asikang aam amin Kaku tu sikaupa tansiki’an, mintus kaskun kuzakuza, maqa Kaku a na malniningzavin.
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

Takna, munhaan aak asang tantungu haan Aki.
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

Talmadiin aam nii tu mapasadu, minliliskin aak istaa.
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。

Sadu a Aki zaku, pakaun zaku ki sikua, paquu zaku ucia.
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.
我今天七點到學校。: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。

Sinsuaz Aki tu sikua madavusdaingaz, tutuza tu masihal saa kaunun.
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.
我今天七點到學校。: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。

Mazima aak amin Aki tu ucia, masihal amin quudan.
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

Isaan tinaungqu, dusa aak Bai mapit’ia paitutaungqu.
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.
我今天七點到學校。: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。

Mapit’ia ka Bai madia tu paitutaungqu, haiza iskaan, haiza maitulkuk, haiza bahat, haiza ang siqut.
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。

Minaun in paitutaungqu, munhaan aam patsanglavan mati’ngus sanglav.
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。

Siza Bai madia tu hutan, tai siin salu-pinasaq masaiv zaku, nadasun dau zaku pulumaq.

我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。

Tukakivuk aingka, tupauk tu namuqna mapasaduu intaa.
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.
我今天七點到學校。: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。

Haip qanian dasun aam Sinsi munhaan patsinanaipukan, ihaan aam hilav pandailaz namabaliv i kipu.

Munkumbu in aam haan patsinanaipukan a, tupa Sinsi tu, “maqa malngus a tastuluqei, maqa tanhiku a tastu’ivut anaka amu saduu.”
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back
我今天七點到學校。: so you can visit them yourself.""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34861/5: 進入動物園後，老師說:「前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。」

Mapising aak ivut, paqpun nii aak saduu ivut.
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.
我今天七點到學校。: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。

Saidu in aak madia luqei, isaan aingka lukis kusbabai, haiz’ang saduu ki bitquh ihaan luak lukis masabaq.

我今天七點到學校。: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。

Patsinanaipukan kumbu haiza zau, uma, lauhu, mainaqabas nii ang saiduu sinanaipuk tun, saiduu in haip mananu manaskal saa.

我今天七點到學校。: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。

Madia naak sinpaisasing, na pasaduu zaku Tama Tina.
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.
我今天七點到學校。: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。

Maqei muqnin na muskun aak Tama Tina masaupa tii.

Ma haip pal’un qanian, dusa aak masituqas-nau’az munhaan Taitu’ tantungu haan pantamaun ta.
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。

Maina haan aam Taihuku tunlaihlai munhaan Taitu’.
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

Panhaan in Taitu’ a, pantamaun ma’unting laihlaih munhaan papandu’an antala zami.
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.
我今天七點到學校。: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。

Papandu’an i pantamaun ta lumaq nii tu pakadaqvis, maun’ting muhiav a pandipin.
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.
我今天七點到學校。: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。

Pantamaun lumaq dingalan haiza madaing tu sasaipukan sinanaipuk, muskun aam tuntauntaun munhaan sasaipukan sinanaipuk.
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。

Ihaan sasaipukan sinanaipuk ta, dasun aam pantamaun mapakaun i sidih siin tun’uma.
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.
我今天七點到學校。: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。

Sanavan, muskun aam muhaan malalabasan dangi’anan ma’un.
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。

Madia malalabasan dangi’anan ta laihlaih, paqpun tundaza aam pautpat mun’ita.
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.
我今天七點到學校。: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。

Namudanin a, sadu tu tangqai’iu’un a pautpaut, lusqa in aam tunvasu mudaan.
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.
我今天七點到學校。: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。

Maa laupadau aam musqais in haan Taihuku, nii niap tu ukiliman in naupa panTamaun tu pautpaut.
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。

Atikis ang aak ihaan aam lumaq Bahu’an, pantu in aak a, tunlusqu in panhaan Taihuku, lusbut in haan Tukai miqumis.
When we were young, our family lived in Bahu’an. After I started school, we moved to Taipei and have been living in the city ever since.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我們家住在馬遠，上學以後，就搬到了台北，一直在都市裡生活。

Vingkiu in Zaingaku a, mapasnava aak pali’uni takiSilazan vungka tu ispasnanava, mingqansiapin tu haizan vaivivaivi tu vungka.
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.
我今天七點到學校。: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。

Paqpun, haip pusana talaban pal’uun, dusa aam inaak masituqas-nanaz musuqis asang tantungu haan madadaingaz, na asa minqansiap anakanak siduq tu vungka.
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.
我今天七點到學校。: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。

Madaingaz haizin tu mavaun qamisan, qaal saduan maszangang talutbu tu Bunun.
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
我今天七點到學校。: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。

Masi’ngav aak istaa tu maaq suu qansaipun qalinga, isia taa sinpalasBunun madauzung, maqansiap amin malasBantalang, malasNgaingai, malasPuut.
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Bunun, as well as Pangcah,  Hakka and Hokkien.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他會哪些語言，他的布農語說得很流利，也會說阿美語、客家話和閩南話。

Masingav istaa minqansiap in tu, paqan i uvaz’az ang aipa mapasnava in malasBantalang, Ngaingai istaa binanau’az, qaal ihaan isiata kuzkuzaun saqal i Puut, paqpun maqansiap aipa madia vaivivaivi tu qalinga.
I asked him to find out that he learned Pangcah when he was a child, his wife is an Hakka, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學阿美話，太太是客家人，而他工作上認識許多閩南人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

Maaq aam mapabazbaz a, maqa madaingaz a pali’uni madia itu qabasan qanup tu kaitaiklasan.
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

Qaal nii aam maqtu ma’laz itqaal tan’a, qaal kusia aam soci sizaan qalinga, na maqtu uqnaun ikmantuk tan’a.
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

Uvaz’az ang aak nii ang uqansaipan anakanak siduq tu vungka, malka anakanak tu takiSilazan a maz’av saa.
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
我今天七點到學校。: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

Madia in ingqansaipun a, dungzav in minqansiap tu Bunun siduq aak, tuza tu makitvaivi, mananu tu maqtu na iskukuniv.
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Bunun is unique and something to be proud of.
我今天七點到學校。: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為布農族人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。

Haip qanian tu minsanavan, masinauba-nanaz na mulumaqin.
My younger brother is going home this evening.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

zaku siin bai munhaan babalivan tulkuk, palhanus mapit’ia paitusanavan na pakaun i masinauba-nanaz.
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

Angqai aam babalivan sanglav, ihaan babalivan-sanglav haiza madia baqlu siniza tu sanglav.
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。

Mabaliv aam sanglav-kabu, tanbuna siin ningzing.
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。

Di’ngalan Taimibabalivan ququt’aqun tu Bunun tupatu, “ma naak bunglai siin qalup madavus. Mabaliva tu tikis maa!”
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
我今天七點到學校。: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

Mabaliv in aam bunglai siin qalup.
We bought pineapples and peaches.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

Angqai aam babalivan titi’, tupa Taimibabalivan tu, “maaq suu nabalivun? maaq haip a tulkuk madaing tu ma’avula, tas’a ka tau saba sui.”
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
我今天七點到學校。: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

Bai tinliskin tu maqlis saa, masingav i Taimibabalivan tu duu maqtu nii tu piqlisun.
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。

Qaal tupa ka Taimibabalivan tu nanu in tu nii tu maqlis, niin maqtu vanaqan maa.
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
我今天七點到學校。: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

Dingalan tu Taimibabalivan tupa tu zain mabaliv inaak iskaan, inaak iskaan madaing tu nii tu maqlis.
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

Kinuz in mabaliv aam tulkuk mabaliv amin iskaan, kalumaqin in mapit’ia ki tastu’sukui tu sanglav.
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。

Talmadia mantala, tinmaqmut in a diqanin.
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
我今天七點到學校。: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

Masinauba-nanaz kazingva musuqis taqu, taisangdangian tisqa nii tu maqtu pal’un, na muqnin tu lihai minsuma.
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
我今天七點到學校。: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

Tupa ka Bai tu haizin madia a pinit’ia, amin i luklas tu zain ma’un!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!
我今天七點到學校。: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!

Tan’ali aam kaupa tais’aan, muskun a ma’un madia sinpit’ia tu paitusanavan.
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

Haiza naak u’uskunan vingkiu tupaun tu Lumav, qanglas aipa panpungul madas qaimangsut.
I have a classmate named Lumav, he often forgets to bring things.
我今天七點到學校。: 我有一個同學叫魯馬夫，他常常忘記帶東西。

Maqi isnavan a, simul aipa isia ta u’uskunan vingkiu tu ispapatas, isqaqaiqais maqi nii a papatasan.
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

Mutas’a, mudusa, mutau, amin pasimul istaa qaimangsut.
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
我今天七點到學校。: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

Qaal haiza istaa madikla tu sinkuzakuza, qanglas simul a nii tu masuqis.
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
我今天七點到學校。: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

Kinuzin a amin as’nii mapasimul istaa.
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
我今天七點到學校。: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

Haiza tu tas’a qanian, muskun aam munata mudandan qaitmal.
One day, we all went on an outing together.
我今天七點到學校。: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

Ihaan daan, asa Lumav munhaan unanataan, qaal panpungul madas isqaqaisu.
On the way, Lumav wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
我今天七點到學校。: 路途中，魯馬夫想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

Simul aipa haan u’uskunan vingkiu i isqaqaisu, qaal amin antalam tu, nii aak amin saimadas.
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.
我今天七點到學校。: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

Lumav minkaivakaiva santangis. Mahau aipa tupa tu, mavia amuu nii tu pasimul i isqaqaisu!
Lumav burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!
我今天七點到學校。: 魯馬夫急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!

U’uskunan vingkiu taqu istaa, aupa nii aas anak madas, amin tu pasimul suu tu qaimangsut, nii tu masuqis!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!
我今天七點到學校。: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

Laqbingin munKaku, Lumav tingmut ang munKaku in, Lumav butun istaa sinimulan u’uskunan tu qaimangsut suqaisun in istaa.
The next day at school, Lumav arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
我今天七點到學校。: 隔天上學，魯馬夫很早就到學校了，魯馬夫把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。

Lumav mansumanai i u’uskunan ta, musasu tupa tu na anak in madas qaimangsut, man uninang u’uskunan vingkiu maqtu haihaip ti mapasimul qaimangsut.
Lumav apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
我今天七點到學校。: 魯馬夫向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。

Inaak Tama sia asang qaqanup tu Bunun.
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

Maaq aak atikis ang a, Tama siin Pantamaun ihaan sanavan mudaan, madas i via siin busul.
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
我今天七點到學校。: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

Tintusqangngin a, madas aingka qainanup tu titi’ musuqis.
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。

Mintun sia vanis, mintun sia haval, duanduan haiza amin linas
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
我今天七點到學校。: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

6.	Isan aingka asang ngaus daan pisihalun mapaqusil qainanupan, maqusil i asang tu Bunun.
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。

Qailis aak buntu tupaki Tama, na sanlavi ki Tama qanup.
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。

Tupa ka Tama tu na tudip i taldaingin aas na tudip aipa madas zaku.
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。

Asang tu banananaz kusia amin haqu madamu taklilibus, matas’i aingka haqu-musqut siin haqu-batu.
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.
我今天七點到學校。: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。

Inaak Tama maqansiap saa matas’i haqu-musqut, tupa Tama tu, maaq aipi a is’patishaqu ki linas, asa ata tu masailang napatishaqun tu dapan, haqu pisanun angqaqaiban na patishaqun tu daan.
My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

Tis’unin na maqtu kava makilavi madadaingaz muskun qanup, mai’siqalis qanian tanam aak matas’i ki haqu, dungzavin inaak tu haqu maqtu in utishaquan.
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
我今天七點到學校。: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

Sadun a Tama ka malkazaku tupa tu na ma dau aak qabasin a nii tu kantang tu qaqanup Bunun.
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。

Lapadau taldaingngin aak, mama’ aak inaak tu busulkaka siin kuus, kinuzkinuz i Tama muskun qanup.
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
我今天七點到學校。: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

Musuqis in asang butun sinqainanup tu titi’ isngunu ki tastu asang Bunun.
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。

Tupa ka Tama tu, asa tu matumasqing tamadaza tu sintuqumis, na maqtu ata uqanupan madia tu qainanup.
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

Halasan aak tingmut munkaku.
I was late for school this morning.
我今天七點到學校。: 我早上上學遲到了。

Ma’almunkaku a, panpungul aak madas i kavaang.
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
我今天七點到學校。: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

Uka naak qaimangsut dasun.
I didn't bring anything with me.
我今天七點到學校。: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

Maqei isnavan a, muskun aak u’uskunan sadu haqil.
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
我今天七點到學校。: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

Maqei siking a, u’uskunan pasimul zaku inpicu siin isqaqaisqais.
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
我今天七點到學校。: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

Tupa sinsi zaku “Maqei muqnin asa tingmutang minnuqu, asa nii’in tu halasan!”
The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""
我今天七點到學校。: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

Inaak kaviaz tupaun tu Sipal, Bunun siduq aipa amin.
My good friend’s name is Sipal, and he is also an Bunun child.
我今天七點到學校。: 我的好朋友叫Sipal，他也是布農族的小孩。

Muskun aam ihaan Bahuan asang vingkiu.
We study together in the Bahuan tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們一起在馬遠村部落讀書。

Qanglas aam muskun tan’a madadaingaz paliqabasan, maqansiap aam malasBunun.
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Bunun proficiently.
我今天七點到學校。: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說布農族。

Madaqvas aak amin tu maqulpiq, ma Sipal a maputis tu makuis.
I am tall and overweight, while Sipal is short and thin.
我今天七點到學校。: 我很高也很胖，Sipal很矮也很瘦。

Matamasaz a Sipal, amin mazima istaa.
Sipal is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
我今天七點到學校。: Sipal很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

Haip qanian isia Kaku tu unzukai, kaku kuzakuza ki madia tu ispaintavtaiv.
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
我今天七點到學校。: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

Haiza pasibutbut, pakantundaq mali’, Mapasinap, iungi, manaq manaqbusulkavil.
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
我今天七點到學校。: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

Paintaivtaiv aam tindakul.
I participated in the running competition.
我今天七點到學校。: 我比賽跑步。

Maqi tindakul aak a, mutingkul aak, madia pisqaidang haan qaa.
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
我今天七點到學校。: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

qaal mindangkaz aak, maldauk masinipa ngaus tindangkul.
But I stood up and continued running forward.
我今天七點到學校。: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

Panhaanin aak pas’upa’an amin a bunun manahip.
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
我今天七點到學校。: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。

anatupa niitu usizaan titas’a ngan, qaal manaskal aak, aupa saukanaqtungin aak paintaivtaiv.
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.
我今天七點到學校。: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

takna dusa aamTama tantungu munhaan patamaun.
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。

pantamau ta bantas milu’lu’.
My uncle injured his foot.
我今天七點到學校。: 叔叔的腳受傷了。

taqu aipa zami, lumaq tu tavi mubuat tas’a tu luak.
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
我今天七點到學校。: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

matas’i aipa tavi ka, maina tavi muqalqal pan’nastu.
He fell off the roof while repairing it.
我今天七點到學校。: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

madas tama ka maiqanvangtiti siin saviki masaiv i pantamaun.
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
我今天七點到學校。: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。

dusa aam pantamaun ihaan sapalan pababazbaz, mangunu aipa taqu madia tu paliqabasan.
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

na mudaan tanangaus, patamaun tusqeing zaku tu taldaqvasin, mintalmaindu’in.
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
我今天七點到學校。: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

tupa aak tu, mantala pantamaun i minsihalin bantas, muqnin minsuma haan lumaq naam qaitmal.
I said, When your foot gets better
我今天七點到學校。: come to our house next time and visit us.""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34861/5: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

ihaan dusa-singing tu mapusan qan dusa qamisan, sihu tau’aniv Pali’uni takiSilazan mivunsiu maqtu pintas’aun siduq ngan tu paliqansiap.
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
我今天七點到學校。: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。

mintivi masingav i malbuntu malka sihu taidangazsiza mivunsiu, paltas’aun madailaz a siduq ngan, tu asang mainduduaz Sipal.
I interviewed Sipal, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
我今天七點到學校。: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Sipal。

paitupa’in aam ihaan haip pal’uun tu diqanin munhaan isiataa lumaq masingav istaa.
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
我今天七點到學校。: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

ihaan tantungu tu aingqaiban, malka zaku aipa taqu maimaquaq isiataa tu ngan, dasun aak mapasaqal isiataa tu tastulumaq, isiataa asang.
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
我今天七點到學校。: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

masingav aak istaa mavia masaa tu asa huvaivan a ngan, tatu’un tu sinpatuki patasan nii tu masihal?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
我今天七點到學校。: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

malka zaku aipa tupa, aupa makumalasTaluu mapatas nii maqtu mamantuk taqu ki isiataa tu ngan, duma bunun maldaukang luklas i siata tu “si’sien’sen”, paqpun minhaiza pinqainanun i bunun.
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Xi Xian Sheng
我今天七點到學校。: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34861/5: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「西先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

tupa Sipal tu, takiSilazan qalinga ispapatas tu ngan sia imita mamantuk tu ngan. Inaak tu ngan min’uni inaam tu siduq, inaam tu tastuqabu, inaam tu hubungsinpangqal, maqtu’ang haiza madia siduq tais’aan ukiliman sisuqaisun tu ngan.
Sipal said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
我今天七點到學校。: our family
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34861/5: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.\""
column5: Sipal說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

dusa aak takna inaak bai munhaan u’a’anpukan mapunhapav babalivan, madas a bai madia kai’anaakan sinsuaz tu sanglav, matas’i amin itutakiSilazan kaununkaunun isaiv i bunun.
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
我今天七點到學校。: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

amin mazima isia bai tu babalivan, madia bunun mabaliv i dabuut siin pa’is, madia amin patanamun ma’un isiataa sihanat isquul.
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
我今天七點到學校。: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

sinhanat tu palaqu siin hakhak mananu masihal kaunun, haizang makusia maivanis laas mahanat qaimus sumalan titi’, hivhiv sakun madia a bunun silansanun, amin ihaan inaam tu babalivan kanadailaz.
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

ma’almahanat bai kakaunun a, ihaan aak dingalan tau’aniv i bunun. Idingalan aak ma’isqit luklas tu, “Sanglav amin kai’anakan masuaz, tail’anaak tal’ia, kavaa mabali maa!”
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown
我今天七點到學校。: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
https://web.klokah.tw/text/sound/34861/5: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

inaam tu kanunkaunun mahiav aminunin isbaliv, tupa bai tu, “Aupa amin mu’u ka mindangaz! ”
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""
我今天七點到學校。: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

maqa kuzkuzaun a, uqansaipan aak pali’uni takiSilazan tu ismumuut siin kakaunun tu kaiqansaipan, amin tu aingqai’in malkamababaliv tu kaisaingu’an.
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
我今天七點到學校。: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

saduu i bai malka’ituqabasan kakaunun tu kaizima’an, maupat aak mastaan makuniv tu matumasqing.
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
我今天七點到學校。: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
